[SYNTAX]: "Do you suppose, Sandy MacPherson, that I'd be carrying a rat around like this?" (awkward comma placement)
"He may stay in the armchair by the fire until I can find a basket for him to sleep in" (cumbersome phrasing)
[LEXICON]: "The poor, wee bairn whined" (dialectal "wee" and "bairn" may be jarring to modern readers)
